Blocks of storage. eg. 1 block for 1wire chips and another for room data. each of different lengths with differnet ids.

get block end index. i.e. the address of last byte used by the block. If block size is 0 there isn't a block end so result will be meaningless.

Detailed Description
Blocks of storage. eg. 1 block for 1wire chips and another for room data. each of different lengths with differnet ids.
Each blocks info if stored in a extern array
Parameters
a
a pointer to an extern array used to store the storage info.
maxBlocks
The size of the array.
startIndex
for example with eeprom it could be 15 to stat using the eeprom at address 15;
Definition at line 38 of file store.h.

readSlot() readSlotstorageBlock_C storageBlock_CreadSlot
bool storageBlock_C::readSlot (byte blockId, byte slot, void * r)
Read a var from permanent storage eg. EEPROM into a var/struct, copys mem of size = to the slot size given when addBlock was called.
Parameters
inblockId
the block of storage, ie. the index to the array
inslot
The slot to read, mem copy len is = the size of the rec/slot
outr
pointer to the memory to copy the slot into. As not using templates need to make sure sizeof(var pointed to by r) >= slot size.
Returns
true if no problems
false if slot > num of slots in block.

writeSlot() writeSlotstorageBlock_C storageBlock_CwriteSlot
bool storageBlock_C::writeSlot (byte blockId, byte slot, void * r)
Write a var into permanent storage eg. EEPROM into a var/struct, copys mem of size = to the slot size given when addBlock was called.
Parameters
inblockId
the block of storage, ie. the index to the array
inslot
The slot to update, mem copy len is = the size of the rec/slot
outr
pointer to the memory to copy into the slot. As not using templates need to make sure sizeof(var pointed to by r) >= slot size.
Returns
true if no problems
false if slot > num of slots in block.
